intro: Eremophila adenotricha, commonly known as the Woolly Emu Bush, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or mauve in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Eremophila adenotricha is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils.
